KH.content: khōra as a name that announces the Other of the name, not logos, not mythos, neither this nor that, both this & that: “not lying when I say this” is that telling the truth?
KH.linkedContent: khōra as a name that announces the Other of the name, not logos, not mythos, neither this nor that, both this & that: “not lying when I say this” is that telling the truth?

KH.content: participates (while being excluded) in the intelligible in an aporetic way, genre beyond genre
KH.linkedContent: participates (while being excluded) in the intelligible in an aporetic way, genre beyond genre

KH.content: double exclusion (neither this nor that), participation (both this & that), can we transport this logic, para-logic from one set to another
KH.linkedContent: double exclusion (neither this nor that), participation (both this & that), can we transport this logic, para-logic from one set to another

KH.content: displacement from type of existent thing to type of discourse via metonymy (sensible/intelligible > mythos/logos)
KH.linkedContent: displacement from type of existent thing to type of discourse via metonymy (sensible/intelligible > mythos/logos)

KH.content: khōra, discourse on genre, genos (ethnos), gens, it is a triton genos [other 2 genus’: 1) immutable 2) sensible]
KH.linkedContent: khōra, discourse on genre, genos (ethnos), gens, it is a triton genos [other 2 genus’: 1) immutable 2) sensible]

KH.content: khōra as mother, nurse; but khōra doesn’t get along w/ rhetoric, metaphor, more situating than situated: no longer belongs to horizon of sense, nor meaning of being
KH.linkedContent: khōra as mother, nurse; but khōra doesn’t get along w/ rhetoric, metaphor, more situating than situated: no longer belongs to horizon of sense, nor meaning of being

KH.content: leave khōra untranslated, thinking & translation here traverse the same experience/experiment (expérience): “place,” “location,” “region,” “country” & its figures, “mother,” “nurse,” “receptacle,” “imprint-bearer” [see p. 126, these figures not even true figures]
KH.linkedContent: leave khōra untranslated, thinking & translation here traverse the same experience/experiment (expérience): “place,” “location,” “region,” “country” & its figures, “mother,” “nurse,” “receptacle,” “imprint-bearer” [see p. 126, these figures not even true figures]

KH.content: [re: inevitable anachronism, teleological retrospection, of translating khōra] Heidegger falls prey in spite of himself [see p. 147n Heidegger: Platonic philosophy prepared move from khōra and Ort (place, topos) to “space (Raum)” defined by extension (Ausdehnung)]
KH.linkedContent: [re: inevitable anachronism, teleological retrospection, of translating khōra] Heidegger falls prey in spite of himself [see p. 147n Heidegger: Platonic philosophy prepared move from khōra and Ort (place, topos) to “space (Raum)” defined by extension (Ausdehnung)]

KH.content: the opposition btwn proper & figurative, relevance of rhetorical code [use of metaphor for that which defies metaphor] meets a limit w/ khōra
KH.linkedContent: the opposition btwn proper & figurative, relevance of rhetorical code [use of metaphor for that which defies metaphor] meets a limit w/ khōra

KH.content: Heidegger: khōra as that which withdraws, “makes place” for something else
KH.linkedContent: Heidegger: khōra as that which withdraws, “makes place” for something else

KH.content: structural law: inevitability of tropology & anachronism, [desire for] totalizing apprehension of interpretations of khōra [re: translating, thinking khōra]
KH.linkedContent: structural law: inevitability of tropology & anachronism, [desire for] totalizing apprehension of interpretations of khōra [re: translating, thinking khōra]

KH.content: w/ no essence, how could khōra be beyond its name? it anachronizes being, and it is like nothing, there beyond its name
KH.linkedContent: w/ no essence, how could khōra be beyond its name? it anachronizes being, and it is like nothing, there beyond its name

KH.content: giving form to khōra, schematizing, repeats Plato’s discourse, in which skhemata are the forms which inform khōra, the forms are of it w/out belonging to it
KH.linkedContent: giving form to khōra, schematizing, repeats Plato’s discourse, in which skhemata are the forms which inform khōra, the forms are of it w/out belonging to it

KH.content: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile
KH.linkedContent: khōra never reached, broached [entamer?], touched, exhausted: not subject, not subjectile

KH.content: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes
KH.linkedContent: a virginity rebellious against anthropomorphism, not order of eidos or mimemes

KH.content: does not give or receive by letting itself be conceived, perhaps we can think reception (dekhomai, dekhomenon) via khōra
KH.linkedContent: does not give or receive by letting itself be conceived, perhaps we can think reception (dekhomai, dekhomenon) via khōra

KH.content: es gibt always implicated in negative theology (in its Christian history?); what there is, there, is not; p. 97 there is khōra, but the khōra does not exist [importance of article]
KH.linkedContent: es gibt always implicated in negative theology (in its Christian history?); what there is, there, is not; p. 97 there is khōra, but the khōra does not exist [importance of article]

KH.content: khōra: something which is not a thing, escapes from order of multiplicities (genus, species, individual type)
KH.linkedContent: khōra: something which is not a thing, escapes from order of multiplicities (genus, species, individual type)

KH.content: risk of feminizing khōra, a female proper name?
KH.linkedContent: risk of feminizing khōra, a female proper name?

KH.content: khōra must keep its impropriety, having nothing of its own, this is what we must keep for it
KH.linkedContent: khōra must keep its impropriety, having nothing of its own, this is what we must keep for it

KH.content: khōra can’t receive the female gender she’s given
KH.linkedContent: khōra can’t receive the female gender she’s given

KH.content: difference btwn calling it/her (elle) in the same manner & calling it/her by the same name [khōra], difference btwn appellation (discourse) & name? is Timaeus an example of this difference or exemplary?
KH.linkedContent: difference btwn calling it/her (elle) in the same manner & calling it/her by the same name [khōra], difference btwn appellation (discourse) & name? is Timaeus an example of this difference or exemplary?

KH.content: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?
KH.linkedContent: entire discourse on khōra, every yet-to-come history of interpretations, included in advance, this X receives all, teleologically programs history of hermeneutics[?], is that a history?

KH.content: khōra possesses all she receives but not as properties
KH.linkedContent: khōra possesses all she receives but not as properties

KH.content: khōra beyond ontological, to give place w/out donor-subject giving something to someone [GT]
KH.linkedContent: khōra beyond ontological, to give place w/out donor-subject giving something to someone [GT]

KH.content: silhouette of a “logic,” impossible to formalize, is this “bastard” logos [outside logic of noncontradiction] mythos?
KH.linkedContent: silhouette of a “logic,” impossible to formalize, is this “bastard” logos [outside logic of noncontradiction] mythos?

KH.content: khōra as abyss, mise en abyme, gaping hole, not exactly chaos or fright, but not Gaia, foundation, either > abyss in encyclopedic logic [of Timaeus], regulates all sites (lieux) on its edges (jobs in society, region, territory, country)
KH.linkedContent: khōra as abyss, mise en abyme, gaping hole, not exactly chaos or fright, but not Gaia, foundation, either > abyss in encyclopedic logic [of Timaeus], regulates all sites (lieux) on its edges (jobs in society, region, territory, country)

KH.content: mise en abyme of discourse on khōra, site of politics, politics of sites; and other that would not be their other [Hegel’s other]
KH.linkedContent: mise en abyme of discourse on khōra, site of politics, politics of sites; and other that would not be their other [Hegel’s other]

KH.content: guardians of city have nothing of their own just like khōra? and the city takes all measures so no parent can recognize their own (child) > a site where law of proper no longer has meaning
KH.linkedContent: guardians of city have nothing of their own just like khōra? and the city takes all measures so no parent can recognize their own (child) > a site where law of proper no longer has meaning

KH.content: Derrida less concerned w/ art of Plato [re: mises en abyme of khōra and politics] but in a constraint, a programme, the being-programme of the programme, the being-logical of logic: Plato apprehends them as such, though in a dream, put en abyme
KH.linkedContent: Derrida less concerned w/ art of Plato [re: mises en abyme of khōra and politics] but in a constraint, a programme, the being-programme of the programme, the being-logical of logic: Plato apprehends them as such, though in a dream, put en abyme

KH.content: belonging of genos [true citizens, philosophers, politicians] to proper place guarantees truth of its logos & action, different to Sophists who have no place, wander
KH.linkedContent: belonging of genos [true citizens, philosophers, politicians] to proper place guarantees truth of its logos & action, different to Sophists who have no place, wander

KH.content: Socrates speaks as true citizen while identifying w/ Sophist, feigns, simulacrum: tells you, you alone have place, gives you the floor > excludes himself by himself by giving back the word; no room for specialists of nonplace or simulacrum in the agora
KH.linkedContent: Socrates speaks as true citizen while identifying w/ Sophist, feigns, simulacrum: tells you, you alone have place, gives you the floor > excludes himself by himself by giving back the word; no room for specialists of nonplace or simulacrum in the agora

KH.content: Socrates as khōra, 3rd genus, for he only resembles the genus of those w/ no place
KH.linkedContent: Socrates as khōra, 3rd genus, for he only resembles the genus of those w/ no place

KH.content: Heidegger: khōra prepares way for “Cartesian space”
KH.linkedContent: Heidegger: khōra prepares way for “Cartesian space”

KH.content: Socrates effaces himself before those he addresses to receive all (pandekhēs), what kind of reception is this? Kantian intuitus derivativus or pure sensibility, the gift of hospitality?
KH.linkedContent: Socrates effaces himself before those he addresses to receive all (pandekhēs), what kind of reception is this? Kantian intuitus derivativus or pure sensibility, the gift of hospitality?

KH.content: w/ Socrates still sense of debt, gift & counter-gift: he is ready to receive the discourses of which he becomes welcoming > khōra glimpse beyond debt?
KH.linkedContent: w/ Socrates still sense of debt, gift & counter-gift: he is ready to receive the discourses of which he becomes welcoming > khōra glimpse beyond debt?

KH.content: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]
KH.linkedContent: Socrates puts himself in place of khōra (place itself, irreplaceable and unplaceable place), thus makes them, makes us talk, implacably [no choice] [see pp. 121-22 Socrates seems to program discourse of his addressees, who will speak?]

KH.content: is Socrates someone, something, play of proper names more abyssal than ever, “who are you, Khōra?”
KH.linkedContent: is Socrates someone, something, play of proper names more abyssal than ever, “who are you, Khōra?”

KH.content: en abyme reflected w/out limit, feeling of dizziness, up against inside face of what wall: chaos, chasm, khōra
KH.linkedContent: en abyme reflected w/out limit, feeling of dizziness, up against inside face of what wall: chaos, chasm, khōra

KH.content: khōra as myth w/in myth, inscribed for a moment, while having a bearing on the place of inscription, oneiric, bastard reading, heterogenous to philosopho-mytheme which orders myth to its philosophical telos ——abyss of khōra doesn’t open all at once, fracture of abyss announced in muted, subterranean way, preparing, propagating simulacra & mises en abymes ——what Marx calls “Egyptian model” [fn refers to unpublished seminar on khōra & Marx, Hegel], ekmageion, print-bearer, imprint, seal
KH.linkedContent: khōra as myth w/in myth, inscribed for a moment, while having a bearing on the place of inscription, oneiric, bastard reading, heterogenous to philosopho-mytheme which orders myth to its philosophical telos ——abyss of khōra doesn’t open all at once, fracture of abyss announced in muted, subterranean way, preparing, propagating simulacra & mises en abymes ——what Marx calls “Egyptian model” [fn refers to unpublished seminar on khōra & Marx, Hegel], ekmageion, print-bearer, imprint, seal

KH.content: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]
KH.linkedContent: in Timaeus, Greeks who have no writing (unlike Egyptians), need myth (destined to perpetual childhood) > memory of city, its salvation, entrusted to the writing of the other [who is the master here?]

KH.content: oral maze inscribed in place which receives everything, Timaeus, addressed to “the one who, as we do, and before us [see p. 117], receives everything,” in this theory of receptions—Socrates
KH.linkedContent: oral maze inscribed in place which receives everything, Timaeus, addressed to “the one who, as we do, and before us [see p. 117], receives everything,” in this theory of receptions—Socrates

KH.content: [re: a logic of living memory in Timaeus] effacement (of secondary impressions) would be the figure for the middle (mil-lieu), both for space and time, would not affect originary impression (that of child), ineffaceable once engraved in virgin wax
KH.linkedContent: [re: a logic of living memory in Timaeus] effacement (of secondary impressions) would be the figure for the middle (mil-lieu), both for space and time, would not affect originary impression (that of child), ineffaceable once engraved in virgin wax

KH.content: what about a virgin wax that is always virgin, always older, preceding any possible impression, and thus younger, achronic, anachronistic [cf. SW pp. 322-23]
KH.linkedContent: what about a virgin wax that is always virgin, always older, preceding any possible impression, and thus younger, achronic, anachronistic [cf. SW pp. 322-23]

KH.content: each narrative content (fable, legend, myth, fiction) becomes in turn a different tale, each tale a receptacle, harboring/lodging (hypodokhè), the most insistent determination of khōra ——but there is no tale of her, a secret w/out secret remains forever impenetrable à son sujet
KH.linkedContent: each narrative content (fable, legend, myth, fiction) becomes in turn a different tale, each tale a receptacle, harboring/lodging (hypodokhè), the most insistent determination of khōra ——but there is no tale of her, a secret w/out secret remains forever impenetrable à son sujet

KH.content: structure of inclusion in Timaeus: included [2nd] fiction, the theme of the prior fiction, which is its [the 2nd fiction’s] including form, its [the 2nd fiction’s] receptacle > mythopoetic string of events [see p. 121 each fiction as content given form in receptacle of another]
KH.linkedContent: structure of inclusion in Timaeus: included [2nd] fiction, the theme of the prior fiction, which is its [the 2nd fiction’s] including form, its [the 2nd fiction’s] receptacle > mythopoetic string of events [see p. 121 each fiction as content given form in receptacle of another]

KH.content: khōra is compared to mother & nurse, not part of oppositional couple, 3rd genus, does not belong to “race of women (genos gynaikōn), mother w/out engendering, not an origin, a before signifying no temporal anteriority [intelligible/sensible looks like father/son couple]
KH.linkedContent: khōra is compared to mother & nurse, not part of oppositional couple, 3rd genus, does not belong to “race of women (genos gynaikōn), mother w/out engendering, not an origin, a before signifying no temporal anteriority [intelligible/sensible looks like father/son couple]

KH.content: relation of interval, of spacing to it what is lodged in it to be received
KH.linkedContent: relation of interval, of spacing to it what is lodged in it to be received

KH.content: backwards steps (retours en arrière), rhythm of Timaeus, go beyond, under philosophical logos, normal couple, to a third, a bastard, hybrid, orphan (khōra) > necessary but not true
KH.linkedContent: backwards steps (retours en arrière), rhythm of Timaeus, go beyond, under philosophical logos, normal couple, to a third, a bastard, hybrid, orphan (khōra) > necessary but not true

KH.content: khōra so virginal it doesn’t even have the figure of a virgin anymore
KH.linkedContent: khōra so virginal it doesn’t even have the figure of a virgin anymore

KH.content: because philosophy can’t speak truly of that which looks like the mother, it speaks only of father/son, as if father engendered son all its own
KH.linkedContent: because philosophy can’t speak truly of that which looks like the mother, it speaks only of father/son, as if father engendered son all its own

KH.content: Plato never qualified khōra as matter (hylè) like Aristotle did
KH.linkedContent: Plato never qualified khōra as matter (hylè) like Aristotle did
